name: Shirasagi-no-mai
description:
Shirasagi-no Mai or the Dance of the White Heron is a ceremonial parade that dates back to the Heian period (8th-12th century) in Kyoto but was revived back in 1968 to celebrate Tokyo’s 100th Anniversary.

Now it is performed a few times a year on the 2nd Sunday of April and on the 3rd of November which is the Culture Day Holiday at the Senso-ji Temple in Asakusa.
